file_content.text: Hurry, Lord Kras must get those reports!
I wish you speed and fortune, my lord.
My lord. Lieutenant Mallohe. May I beg a moment of your time?
Of course, Lieutenant. I always have time for our fighting forces.
Absolutely.
Your graciousness does me a great honor.
Are you really going to beg? I might enjoy that.
Grovel, first.
If my lord requires.
I humbly ask my lord for the honor of speaking so that we might both serve the needs of the Empire.
Rise and report, Lieutenant.
You may speak.
You may be a bit zealous in your loyalty. Learn to spot when someone is having fun with you.
I was only joking.
As you say, my lord.
There's something wonderful about absolute power over others.
I did enjoy that.
I am glad my lord approves.
You have earned your minute of my time, Lieutenant. Make it good.
Fine, fine. Talk.
Get off the floor, Lieutenant. You embarrass yourself.
This is wrong.
I do as my lord commands. As will you if you expect to survive Dromund Kaas.
As long as you've got her performing tricks, maybe a dance routine?
Make her sing next!
I serve the Sith, not the galaxy's unwashed masses.
You won't find me on my knees like that in front of anyone.
Pathetic, Lieutenant.
I am shocked you've managed to survive until now. I advise you park that attitude before you reach the Citadel.
We have things to do, and torturing the locals isn't on the list.
Do we have time for this?
I did not mean to delay a Sith on urgent business.
My master awaits me in Kaas City. I cannot waste time.
Make it fast.
Nor would I ever seek to delay you, my lord. Our goals coincide.
Some sort of official trouble you need a Sith for?
Looks like Sith business.
In a sense. And as my lord sees fit to let you speak, I shall assume you are here on Sith business as well.
"My lord," huh? Very fancy. All I get is a lot of "Hey you!"
Nobody ever calls me "lord."
I suggest you keep your offworld mouth shut, bounty hunter, until you learn to show the proper respect for your Sith betters.
I don't suppose I'll ever have people calling me "my lord."
I want a fancy title.
You will show the proper respect to the Sith in your midst, agent, or I will have you reported.
Sorry, Lieutenant, but we're in a bit of a hurry.
We don't have time for this.
The decision is not yours to make. You stand in the presence of Sith. They make the Empire's decisions.
Agent? Lieutenant Mallohe. I have gained authorization from Keeper to contract your services for a short time.
You, bounty hunter! I require your services. Are you for hire?
Luck smiles on me after all. I am Lieutenant Mallohe of the Imperial Navy, and I require your services.
At this moment, Lord Kras is meeting with the Minister of War to make recommendations for our next moves against the Republic.
I've prepared his reports, but he also desires a personal interview with someone involved in the recent fighting.
So you haven't been involved in the "recent fighting."
And you can't oblige?
I've been assigned to Dromund Kaas for the past six months, and the galaxy is changing quickly.
Please, make sure these documents get to Lord Kras in the Citadel in a timely fashion.
Tell me where to find your lord, and I'll be on my way.
I'd be glad to help.
He's in the Citadel; please proceed in a timely fashion.
And remember to show Lord Kras, and any other Sith you meet, the proper level of respect.
It is only with the insight and wisdom of the Sith that we can hope to win this war and conquer the hated Republic forever.
I don't make deliveries or conduct post-combat interviews.
You're joking. [Refuse quest]
Understood. There must be someone else who survived the fight against the Brentaal Star....
Please, I am quite busy.
Greetings, my lord. I hope you enjoy your stay on Dromund Kaas.
